required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diet, Nutrient Status, and Food Insecurity
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dietary Supplementation on Nutrient Status in Families Living in a Food Insecure Environment

brief_summary.textblock: Arkansas has one of the highest rates for food insecurity and 27.7% of children in the University of Arkansas area are food insecure. In addition, more than 14% of children ages 2-4 are obese and 20% of children ages 10-17 are obese. In Northwest Arkansas, the area surrounding the University of Arkansas in Fayetteville (Washington County), the food insecurity rate for adults is 17.9% (an estimated 34,730 individuals) and the food insecurity rate for children under 17 years of age is 24.4% (12,150 individuals). In addition, the surrounding counties have similar food insecurity rates (This makes Northwest Arkansas an ideal location to conduct a pilot study focusing on egg supplementation, childhood obesity, and food insecurity (http://www.feedingamerica.org/hunger-in-america/our-research/map-the-meal-gap).

primary_outcome.time_frame: The change in micronutrient status (e.g. iron, vitamin A, vitamin B12) will be measured from baseline to 16 weeks to determine if the dietary intervention improves baseline micronutrient status.
primary_outcome.description: Micronutrients status will be measured using plasma samples.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The change in body composition (e.g. ratio of lean to fat mass) will measured from baseline to 16 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Body composition will be measured using dual X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) .

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change in height will be measured from baseline to 16 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Height (in centimeters) will be measured using a stadiometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change in weight will be measured from baseline to 16 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Weight (in kilograms) will be measured using a scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change in waist-to-hip ratio will be measured from baseline to 16 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Waist-to-hip ratio will be measured using the protocol outlined by the World Health Organization.

intervention.description: Participants will required to consume 2 eggs per day, 5 days a week (a total of 10 eggs per week).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Food insecurity assessed by use of SNAP benefits or qualifying using the US Food Security Scale).
Exclusion Criteria:
- No dietary restrictions
- Fear of needles
- Metabolic disorders
- Picky eating
- Taking medication
